TopicTitle: [1.12.X] Tantares - Stockalike Soyuz and MIR [16.1][28.05.2024][{Proton Revamp]

Articles.Content:
4 hours ago, Kuiper_Belt said:

Loving the part revamp! Fantastic Job!

Holy shiznat. Whatever mods you are running, this screenshot looks almost photo-realistic.

Please consider adjusting 4MV's pressure limits for KSRSS. The probe explodes while flying mid-Venusian atmosphere in 2.5x rescaled system due to, well, exceeding pressure limits.

Edited June 29, 2021 by biohazard15

16 hours ago, Kuiper_Belt said:

Loving the part revamp! Fantastic Job!

Incredible! Among the best mir builds I have seen. Would be delighted to use it for the thumbnail this release if you don't mind.

12 hours ago, Raqnick said:

What about a paraschute on Luna 16 capsule ?

Unfortunately last minute issues made the parachute untenable due  to stock-game bugs.

But, the capsule is reinforced to not require a chute.

11 hours ago, biohazard15 said:

Please consider adjusting 4MV's pressure limits for KSRSS. The probe explodes while flying mid-Venusian atmosphere in 2.5x rescaled system due to, well, exceeding pressure limits.

Sure, if you have some suggested numbers I can include these in the next version.

14 hours ago, biohazard15 said:

The probe explodes while flying mid-Venusian atmosphere

.... shouldn't it, though...?

4 hours ago, Beale said:

Incredible! Among the best mir builds I have seen. Would be delighted to use it for the thumbnail this release if you don't mind.

Go right ahead!

4 hours ago, Beale said:

Sure, if you have some suggested numbers I can include these in the next version.

staticPressureASL = 7.09275E+03 (that's from KSRSS' Venus.cfg. Rescale config does not change atmospheric pressure).

How exactly pressure limits work in KSP? Is it possible to have things fail after some time? Or it's just plain "you go over a certain limit, you die on the spot"? Would be cool if probe worked for a limited time before succumbing to environment, just like the real thing did.

2 hours ago, Daniel Prates said:

.... shouldn't it, though...?

Only early landers (Venera 4-6). Later landers were designed to withstand up to 180 bar.

On 6/28/2021 at 1:16 PM, Beale said:

Are you using the WIP version from GitHub maybe? Official releases should not have deprecated parts installed - I recommend a clean install.

Copy paste the folder "N1" , then in the config files - you will need to make sure the paths pointing to the models are correct.

 

 

TantaresSAF Version 1.0

This took a while, but this mod is finally no longer a weird secret download.
Should be available on CKAN soon.

TantaresSAF - GitHub
(Simple Adjustable Fairings)

To use these, you need Simple Adjustable Fairings!



Hey, with the SAF Progress fairing, would it be possible to make variations for the soyuz parts to make them look like the Soyuz 2.1 boosters/core and a white staging plate? Intercolor has gray core parts but its just not dark enough, Would be very cool.

2 hours ago, biohazard15 said:

staticPressureASL = 7.09275E+03 (that's from KSRSS' Venus.cfg. Rescale config does not change atmospheric pressure).

How exactly pressure limits work in KSP? Is it possible to have things fail after some time? Or it's just plain "you go over a certain limit, you die on the spot"? Would be cool if probe worked for a limited time before succumbing to environment, just like the real thing did.

Only early landers (Venera 4-6). Later landers were designed to withstand up to 180 bar.

Many thanks.

Re: "How exactly pressure limits work in KSP?"

Unfortunately I think it's just a flat number, rather than any cool mechanic for crunching over time.

1 hour ago, CardZLol said:

Hey, with the SAF Progress fairing, would it be possible to make variations for the soyuz parts to make them look like the Soyuz 2.1 boosters/core and a white staging plate? Intercolor has gray core parts but its just not dark enough, Would be very cool.

 

I would very much like to add some colour options for Soyuz at some point, so i will put this in mind for definite.

If you have a possibility to open a GitHub issue on the TantaresLV repo, I will have a better chance to remember.

 

 

 

 

 

yorb

On 6/9/2014 at 4:23 AM, Beale said:

The new version is up!

I have totally re-done all the models and textures. Including a few more "stock" texture elements I think they're looking the real deal now.

Balancing might still be off, I think they should both still be capable of their intended use.

As always, feedback is very helpful, especially for balance (which I'm terrible at)!

Thanks for all the support!

I think next I'll work on some alternate colour schemes.

 

My how this wonderful collection of mods has changed since back then.

Sure, if you have some suggested numbers I can include these in the next version.

Oh,hello.Could you please add Luna parts(1,2,3,9,10,11) and Molniya satellite ?

On this episode of the VA meltdown saga:  M&B discovers spooky heating!

So I decided to boot up KSP and look into the VA and it's heatshield.  But you know what?  I'm lazy.  So I use the cheat to orbit option then do my normal re-entry... only this time the VA stays cool as a cat on bread.

Well now I'm stumped.  So normal launch just to be sure.  VA esplodes upon re-entry.....

WELP now I'm stumped.  If you cheat the VA/TKS and Proton to orbit, the VA doesn't heat up.  If you do a normal launch, VA heats up and explodes.

 Here  is my craft file.

I'm in JNSQ, 150x150km orbit at 45 degrees inclination.  I de-orbit until Mechjeb landing guidance says 4.4g.  And yes, I have cheat orbited the whole proton stack to see if it's a part interaction with the fairings or the Launch Escape Tower, but it might be KSP's buggy heat system.
